Dear Ms. Sears:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
December 18, 2018. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of
the ISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of
this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions.
Sincerely,

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records.
(3) The personnel record shall contain both of the
following:
(a) A written evaluation of a staff member's performance
within a probationary period or not later than 6 months
after the staff member assumes his or her current
responsibilities. After the initial evaluation, a written
evaluation shall be conducted each year.
One of six employees did not have a performance evaluation
within a probationary period.
R 400.12325 License recommendation.
(1) An agency shall recommend to the department the
appropriate licensing action consistent with facts
contained in the foster home evaluation and any special
evaluations.
Changes made to the terms of the license were not thoroughly
assessed in the addendums in one of six foster home files.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make
a licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of six reevaluations was not completed at least 15 days
before the expiration date.
4

R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
(c) The allegations.
The allegations in four of four special evaluations were not
clearly written as they relate to possible rule violations.
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(1) An agency's medical and dental care policy shall, at a
minimum, include all of the following:
(c) A physical examination for each child as follows,
unless a greater frequency is medically indicated:
(ii) For a child 2 years of age or older, a physical
examination shall have been completed within 12 months
before placement or a new physical examination shall be
completed within 30 calendar days after placement.
One of six physical exams was completed 19 days late.
(repeat violation)
R 400.12413 Medical and dental care policy.
(2) An agency shall have documentation from the medical
or dental provider of all medical and dental care received
by a foster child.
One of six foster children had no documentation from the dental
provider.
5

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Two of six USPs were late. One was late by seven days and
the other was late by 26 days.
(repeat violation)
R 400.12504 Eligibility requirements.
(2) All of the following shall be in the case record before a
youth is placed in independent living:
(f) Proof that financial support to meet the youth's
housing, clothing, food, and miscellaneous expenses is
available.
One of three IL youth has not received a DHHS payment since
September 2018. The agency is working with the DHHS/POS
worker to resolve this. The agency did not complete budgets
with the youth for the months of September, October or
November 2018 to determine that his needs for housing,
clothing, food and miscellaneous expenses are being met.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following
information and documentation, which shall be recorded
within 30 calendar days after placement in independent
living and updated at least once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service
plan must address the living arrangement for the child or
children, visitation/parenting time with the youth's
6

biological children or a clear explanation why this is not
possible or appropriate.
Two USPs were completed late for two of three IL youth.
5 & 19 days late
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in compliance
will all ISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 6.18 Relative foster parents must be licensed within 180 days of
application
Four of nine applicants were not licensed within 180 days.
(repeat non-compliance)
ISEP 6.33 Parent/Guardian signatures of PATPs
One PATP was not signed by the parent for one of six foster
children.
(repeat non-compliance)
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note that there
are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included in section
1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements
except for the following:
FOM 723 School documentation
For one of six foster children, there was no fall report card, no
school records requested and no school letter sent.
FOM 722-08C Caregivers must sign the PATP
One PATP was not signed by the caregiver for one of six foster
children.
7

FOM 722-6H Unannounced home visits quarterly
Two unannounced home visits were missed for two of six foster
children.
(repeat non-compliance)
FOM 722-06I Sibling visits must occur monthly for siblings who are split
In September 2018, one sibling visit was missed for one of six
foster children.
FOM 802 Mental Health Screening within 30 days of admission
One of six foster children did not have a mental health
screening (ASQ) within 30 days.
(repeat non-compliance)
ADM 300 Adoptive Child Assessments are to be completed within 45
days of case acceptance
One of three assessments was completed 8 days late.
(repeat non-compliance)
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
A brief training was held with the licensing workers, licensing supervisor and chief
administrator. The following issues were addressed:
 When is it appropriate to interview case managers for findings in a foster home
investigation?
 Translating an allegation into potential foster home rule violation language
 Staying focused on the allegation(s) and potential licensing rule violations while
conducting interviews
 Avoid quoting other child welfare professionals in reports
 Choosing the most appropriate potential rule violation(s) before submitting a 259
8

 Referencing the corresponding agency policy when assessing potential rule
violations for R 400.9403 (d) (i) – (xiii) Foster parent duties.
 Understanding additional findings vs new allegations
Independent Living
 Uploading eligibility documentation under the Financial tab in MISACWIS
 Requesting supervisory assistance immediately when there are issues with
payment
ANALYST CONCERNS & RESOLUTIONS
Alert 1 – No Concerns
Alert 2 – No Concerns
Alert 3 – No Concerns
Alert 4
Concern: The biological father reported not being involved in decisions regarding his
son's medical needs or notified of medical appointments. The father also reported that
the foster care worker has only been to his home twice in approximately 14 months.
Resolution: The biological father has been involved in decision making regarding his
son’s medical needs. He received and signed copies of PATPs dated 3/26, 6/25 and
9/22. The child had physical exams on 2/6/18, 5/7/18, 8/20/18 and 11/12/18. The
father was notified of these appointments via FTMs, phone or during weekly parenting
time. The father also participated in FTMs on 3/22, 6/21, 9/21 and 11/28.
Assessments of the father’s residence were completed on 4/12/18 1and 10/17/18.
However, a home assessment due in July 2018 was missed. Noncompliance – FOM
722-06H page 9- The caseworker must have face-to-face contact with each
parent/guardian at least once each calendar month, with at least one contact in each
quarter occurring in the parent’s place of residence.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect or corporal
punishment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted one acceptable corrective action plan for the Interim
inspection completed in January 2018.
- R 400.12205 (5) Required Staff. The agency has made substantial progress with this
noncompliance. All new hires in 2018 have provided a copy of their transcripts.
9

- R 400.12404 (7)(a)(i) - (vii) Placement. The agency has made substantial progress with
this noncompliance. The Initial placement document was updated to include supervisory
signature prior to placement to ensure no information is missing.
- R 400.12413 (1)(c)(ii) Medical and dental policy. The agency has made good progress
with this noncompliance. The intake packet has been updated to include a deadline for
the initial medical exam for the youth.
- R 400.12417(1)(a)-(i) Foster parent information. The agency made good progress with
this noncompliance. The MCHS initial and replacement outlines were updated to include
supervisor review prior to placement.
-R 400.12418(2)(a)- Development of service plans. The agency has made good
progress with this noncompliance but is continuing to work on full compliance. The foster
care workers to use MiSACWIS Book of Business as a case management tool for
timeliness of reports. The case managers are checking their book of business once a
week and should be submitting their service plans 7 days prior to their due dates.
-R 400.12418(2)(b)- Development of service plans. The agency has made progress with
this noncompliance but is continuing to work on full compliance. The foster care workers
are to use MiSACWIS Book of Business as a case management tool for timeliness of
reports. The case managers are checking their book of business once a week and
should be submitting their service plans 7 days prior to their due dates.
-R 400.12421(b) - Visitation and parenting time. The agency has made substantial
progress with this noncompliance. The foster care case managers have a designated
day (Friday) to complete all data entry. This is monitored on a weekly basis by the foster
care supervisor and monthly during supervision.
-FOM 722.6H- Unannounced home visits must occur every quarter. The agency made
progress with this noncompliance but is continuing to work on full compliance. The
agency implemented designated unannounced months- February, May, August and
November to complete visits.
-FOM 801 (pg. 14) - Medical Passports must be provided to foster parents within 14
days. The agency has made substantial progress with this noncompliance. The agency
now gives medical passports to foster parents at the time of placement as a part of their
intake packet.
-FOM 801- Health Documentation. The agency has made good progress with this
noncompliance. Foster care workers are reviewing all child exam forms prior to
uploading in the system and if a page is missing they will wait to upload until the whole
packet is received.
- ISEP 6.43 pg32- A mental health screening must be completed within 30 days of
placement. The agency has made good progress with this noncompliance. The
agency’s foster care workers are making active efforts to ensure that foster parents and
physicians return completed ASQ forms or another appropriate tool.
-ISEP 6.55c- Parents/Guardians must sign PATPs. The agency has made substantial
progress with this noncompliance. The agency has made good progress with this
noncompliance. The agency’s foster care workers are making active efforts to ensure
that they are engaging parents in the development of their PATP and obtaining parental
signatures on a quarterly basis.
-ISEP 6.18- Relative applicants must be licensed within 180 days. The agency continues
to make efforts to come into compliance with this measure by monitoring referrals for
10

DHHS to ensure that the referrals are appropriate for acceptance. The licensing
specialist reviews the referrals with the supervisor during supervision.
-ADM 300- Child Assessments are due 45 days after case acceptance.
-ADM 330- Quarterly reports are due 90 days after the child assessment is due and
every 90 days thereafter. The agency made substantial progress toward both of these
adoption non-compliances. The adoption supervisor continues to utilize a reports due list
which assists with tracking due dates.
V. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
